body.p:
Lexington Feb 27 1861
Gov. Magoffin
Dr Sir,

At the present Term of this Court an Indictment was found against Dennis Mulligan for Giving Liquor to a slave of O A Reynolds. I was present in the very town where the evidence was detailed. There was no proof of rule. Mulligan is a respectable grocer who does a large business, and I never heard him suspected of any thing of this sort before. He acknowledges that he gave the liquor to the slave, but says and I believe the statement that he intended no violation of the law. Still it was a violation, and with the permission of the Court, he confessed Judgment for $50- As I know Mulligan, and do not think he intended to do wrong, I have thought proper at his request to say this much to your excellency with the hope that you will grant him remission

Respectfully
W. S Lowery
Com atty

Fayette
Remitted
B. M.
Isd Feby 28 1861
